content.raw:
That's interesting, I didn't know that universal joints force the axes to be perpendicular. I just created one non perpendicular with the model editor and the physics engine immediately forced the bodies to be perpendicular.

I just didn't understand very well what you meant by the rotation being equal. It sounds like the rotations are coupled, which it's not the case. But maybe you meant something else?
content.html:
That's interesting, I didn't know that universal joints force the axes to be perpendicular. I just created one non perpendicular with the model editor and the physics engine immediately forced the bodies to be perpendicular.

I just didn't understand very well what you meant by the rotation being equal. It sounds like the rotations are coupled, which it's not the case. But maybe you meant something else?
